he Orc Road was the thoroughfare between Amnian cities of Crimmor and Purskul.
thumb|The location of the Orc Road in Amn.|390x390px
The Orc Road was the name given to a patch of the Trade Way in Zehoarastria region between Crimmor and Purskul. Farms, family estates, and small agricultural communities filled the stretch of the road, providing the two cities with grains and produce.
The roads name derived from it being used by orcish hoards that descended from the Cloud Peaks several times through Amns history, including the  and the . These two events lead to a large half-orc population in the town of Purskul and the nearby communities. Orc survivors from the failed invasions were enslaved, and their labor was used to pave and maintain the Orc Road.
Sometime circa the , brutal Lord Alathallgo Gathalynker of the Gathalynker family was murdered and, allegedly, eaten by his orcish slaves on the Orc Road. The Lords body was hastily buried somewhere along the road. In the , Alathallgos skull adorned in his ornate enchanted helmet was unearthed, but the rest of magical armor and other wondrous items were still believed lost, and buried along the Orc Road. As of the late 14 century DR, the Gathalynkers continued the search for Alathallgos magical equipment under cover of night, despite the local governments protests and drovers driving their carriages into excavated holes late into the evening.
*Flagonsrich Estate, known for its large gardens and vineyards to the west. As the Orc Road crossed the estates grounds, a massive holy symbol of Chauntea constructed out of living multi-colored roses could be seen from afar brain a major landmark of the area.
